page.title: 09CUSTOMS AT HATCH BEAUCHAMP
page.content: The Flower Show is held in a marquee on Hatch Beauchamp playing field every August. It consists of many competitions, mainly craft and floral classes but there are a few classes for vegetables as well. Pancake Races are held on Shrove Tuesday. The idea is that you have to be first to the finishing line, after running along while tossing a pancake in a frying pan. On Guy Fawkes night, an enormous bonfire is built and a dummy of Guy Fawkes is placed on top. In the evening the bonfire is lit and there is a firework display. Near Christmas time there is an enormous supper in Hatch Beauchamp village hall. There is a performance by a vilage organisation and the choir sings some unusual carols to finish off the evening.
